parse.title: Zamorak, Lord of Chaos
parse.text:
This article has a strategy guide.
All information on mechanics, setups, and tactics is on the subpage.
"Zamorak boss" redirects here. For the Zamorakian general in the God Wars Dungeon, see K'ril Tsutsaroth.
This article is about the boss. For the character in lore, see Zamorak.

Zamorak, Lord of Chaos
Release4 July 2022 (Update)
RaceMahjarrat
MembersYes
QuestNo
LocationThe Zamorakian Undercity

OptionsExamine
ExamineThe chaotic Mahjarrat who ascended to godhood by stabbing Zaros with the Staff of Armadyl.
Advanced data
NPC ID23164
LinksMRND23164
[view] • [talk]

Zamorak, Lord of Chaos[1] is one of the major gods of RuneScape and the final boss of The Zamorakian Undercity. Originally a mortal Mahjarrat from the hazardous plane of Freneskae, he climbed through the ranks of the Zarosian Empire to become its highest-ranking general before dethroning Zaros with the Staff of Armadyl and ascending to godhood himself. This historic event ushered in the God Wars, throughout which he and the other gods who remained after Zaros' departure battled over Gielinor until Guthix woke from his slumber and banished the gods with the Edicts of Guthix. When the Edicts fell with Guthix's death, Zamorak was the second god to return to Gielinor after Saradomin.

Following the events of the Elder God Wars and his absorption of the Eye of Het's powers, Zamorak has fortified himself beneath the Wilderness inside the Vestibule of Futility where he has been opening portals to allow demons from Infernus to travel to Gielinor to aid his bidding in subduing the many human-governed cities. With help from the Guardians of Guthix, the World Guardian has learned how to cast the Edicts of Guthix and intends to infiltrate Zamorak's fortress to cast them for a second time, aiming to banish all major gods from Gielinor once more.

Rewards from the encounter include a codex to unlock the Chaos Roar melee ability, the vestments of havoc set (a tier 95 melee power armour with passive effects), codices to upgrade Sunshine and Death's Swiftness into their greater variants, and components to create the Bow of the Last Guardian, a tier 95 bow.[2]

Unlike the other final elite dungeon bosses, Zamorak can be immediately accessed through the teleport option on the Treasure chest found at the start of the dungeon upon completing the Conqueror of Chaos achievement, which requires one full clear of The Zamorakian Undercity on either Normal or Hard Mode.

Zamorak also utilises an enrage system in hard mode — he has a higher cap of 60,000% enrage, though his health is capped to a specific amount like Telos[1] and kill streaking is not offered due to the boss' loot mechanics. This means it is possible to safely teleport out of the encounter rather than being a fight to the death.

Obtaining all unique rewards from Zamorak completes the Been There, Done That, Got the Z-shirt achievement which awards the title, Godslayer [Name].

Strategies[edit | edit source]

Main article: The Zamorakian Undercity/Strategies

Before the encounter, Zamorak is surrounded by six chaos witch channelers that work to corrupt the runes. Once the last channeler is killed, Zamorak will engage the team.

Zamorak utilises an enrage system in a manner similar to Telos, the Warden and the Arch-Glacor. Zamorak has two health bars, his actual health bar, and a secondary "shield" bar that rapidly recovers damage. To halt the shield's powers, the team must uncorrupt a rune by standing on its respective pad and charge it, after which both the player and Zamorak will increase their combat capabilities (in the forms of buffs/debuffs/mechanics). When his actual health reaches specific thresholds, he will begin the next phase, deploying another shield and calling a channeler into Infernus, who must be slain in order to progress further into the fight.

In an encounter of 100% or more enrage, the fight is extended an additional phase, where Zamorak drags the team with him to Infernus to obliterate them with a "world-ending" attack. This phase involves mechanics from four of the six runes, and it also reverses the activation order from the first six phases.

The life points during phases 1–6 cap at 1,600,000 per player at 1,740% enrage, while phase 7 caps at 250,000 life points per player at the start of the fight at 1,000% enrage. Many of Zamorak's mechanics are modified starting at 500% enrage, with new modifications at 750%, 900%, 1,000%, 1,500%, and 1,600% enrage.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Zamorak, Lord of Chaos does not drop charms.

Drop mechanics[edit | edit source]

Upon Zamorak's defeat, a chest called the World Guardian's treasure appears by the Sword of Edicts for players to collect their rewards from. The chest can be right-clicked to access the bank. If the player dies as the fight ends, or if they exit the dungeon instance for any reason after defeating Zamorak, they are able to collect their loot from the treasure chest outside of The Zamorakian Undercity entrance by right-clicking the chest and selecting "Collect boss loot".

Rewards can be rerolled with a chaos die reroll token, generating a new chest of rewards, as long as none of the items were taken. This can only be done once per completed encounter, and can potentially reroll into a signature drop.

Common loot[edit | edit source]

The enrage that Zamorak was defeated at determines the quantity of drops given through the form of invisible points. Completing the dungeon prior to defeating Zamorak multiplies the amount of points by 1.75, which is then rounded down. Story Mode is not affected by this bonus.

2,000+ 140

These points are then "spent" when rolling on the common loot table. There is an equal 1/13 chance of hitting each section on the common table.

Signature drops[edit | edit source]

If a player has been chosen to receive a signature drop, an animation of green particles will surround their character. Whether a player receives a signature drop is decided as the fight ends, with the specific reward rolled upon opening the chest.

The chance to roll on the signature drop table is presented in the table below. Having tier 4 luck decreases the denominator by one. Completing the dungeon prior to defeating Zamorak multiplies the denominator by 0.75.

Enrage or mode Initial chance
Story Mode 1/500
Normal Mode 1/100
0–19% 1/100
20–49% 1/99
50–99% 1/97
100–149% 1/80
150–199% 1/77
200–299% 1/72
300–399% 1/67
400–499% 1/62
500–749% 1/52
750–899% 1/47
900–999% 1/40
1,000–1,249% 1/37
1,250–1,499% 1/35
1,500–1,999% 1/31
2,000%+ 1/28

Assuming that Zamorak is fought at 99% or lower enrage, the chances upon rolling the unique drop table would be as follows:

  • 12.5% to obtain a Bow of the Last Guardian piece
  • 36% chance to obtain a random piece of vestments of havoc (four pieces, 9% each)
  • 16.5% chance for a Chaos Roar ability codex
  • 35% chance for a Codex of lost knowledge

Completions of 100% and higher enrage encounters begin to increase the chances of getting a bow piece while decreasing the chance for a codex of lost knowledge, according to the following table. This happens alongside the increase of the chance to roll on the signature drop table. This changes the expected number of unique rewards to complete the boss collection log.

Enrage Bow piece chance Codex of lost knowledge chance Uniques required for boss log
0-99% 12.5% 35% 35.6

500–749% 17.5% 30% 29.2
750–899% 18.5% 29% 28.5
900–999% 19% 28.5% 28.2
1,000–1,249% 20% 27.5% 27.7
1,250–1,999% 21% 26.5% 27.2
2,000%+ 22.5% 25% 26.6

Bad luck mitigation[edit | edit source]

If a player completes ten kills without rolling the signature drop table, a bad luck mitigation begins to take effect. The denominator of the drop chance is decreased for each kill past this threshold, with the number by which it is decreased and the maximum drop chance capped depending on the enrage of the kill. Based on these rules, the average number of kills required to roll on the drop table may be calculated[notes 1] if the same enrage is repeatedly run until a signature drop is received. Bad luck mitigation does not affect Story Mode or kills below 100% enrage.

Using a chaos die reroll token counts towards and progresses the bad luck mitigation mechanic.[3]

  • Zamo-whacked I ( 5) – Defeat Zamorak, Lord of Chaos (X/5)
  • Zamo-whacked II ( 5) – Defeat Zamorak, Lord of Chaos (X/10)
  • Zamo-whacked III ( 5) – Defeat Zamorak, Lord of Chaos (X/25)
  • Zamo-whacked IV ( 5) – Defeat Zamorak, Lord of Chaos (X/50)
  • Zamo-whacked V ( 5) – Defeat Zamorak, Lord of Chaos (X/75)
  • Zamo-whacked VI ( 5) – Defeat Zamorak, Lord of Chaos (X/100)
  • Are You Winning, Zam?  I ( 5) – Defeat Zamorak at 50% enrage in a solo encounter.
  • Are You Winning, Zam? II ( 10) – Defeat Zamorak at 100% enrage in a solo encounter.
  • Are You Winning, Zam? III ( 15) – Defeat Zamorak at 250% enrage in a solo encounter.
  • Are You Winning, Zam? IV ( 20) – Defeat Zamorak at 500% enrage in a solo encounter.
  • Are You Winning, Zam? V ( 25) – Defeat Zamorak at 750% enrage in a solo encounter.
  • Are You Winning, Zam? VI ( 30) – Defeat Zamorak at 1,000% enrage in a solo encounter.
  • Lord of Chaos (Bronze) ( 0) – Obtained by defeating the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos encounter at 1,000% enrage.
  • Lord of Chaos (Silver) ( 0) – Obtained by defeating the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos encounter at 2,000% enrage.
  • Lord of Chaos (Gold) ( 0) – Obtained by defeating the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos encounter at 4,000% enrage.
  • Wrath of Chaos ( 0) – Obtained by defeating the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos encounter at 500% enrage solo.
  • Wrath of Chaos (Bronze) ( 0) – Obtained by defeating the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos at 1,000% enrage solo.
  • Wrath of Chaos (Silver) ( 0) – Obtained by defeating the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos at 2,000% enrage solo.
  • Wrath of Chaos (Gold) ( 0) – Obtained by defeating the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos at 4,000% enrage solo.
  • Been There, Done That, Got the Z-shirt ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Zamorak, Lord of Chaos.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 29 January 2024 (Update):
    • Runes in phase 7 of the Zamorak encounter will once again heal above their max HP on death. Values have been slightly adjusted to account for solo mode having halved rune HP, to reduce the chance of double-killing runes.
  • patch 22 January 2024 (Update):
    • The health of Runes in Zamorak's solo phase 7 has been halved.
  • patch 13 November 2023 (Update):
    • Clickboxes have been reduced on the Runes in phase seven of the Zamorak fight.
    • Infernal Runes will no longer explode on contact in phase seven if you defeated him during Infernal Tomb.
    • Last Used Enrage option has been added to the Zamorak encounter list.
    • The number of runs through the Zamorakian Undercity required to unlock direct access to Zamorak has been reduced from 25 to just 1.
    • Resolved an issue with reflected damage causing locks on Zamorak.
    • Fixed issues with the extra action button in the Zamorak lord of chaos boss fight
      • Added a small cooldown to prevent spam teleporting as this would prevent players from teleporting back to their original coordinates.
      • Added a fix to prevent Zamorak’s Infernal Tomb attack from teleporting the player if they were already in Infernus.
    • Fixed an issue where Zamorak could sneak an attack out if pre-stunned during the Infernal Tomb special attack.
  • patch 16 January 2023 (Update):
    • Added in boss tactics for Zamorak, Lord of Chaos.
  • update 7 November 2022 (Update):
    • Herb drops replaced with their seeds instead.
  • ninja 20 September 2022 (Update):
    • Bad luck mitigation can now only be accumulated if you are doing kills at 100% enrage or higher.
    • Your bad luck mitigation modifier now increases at different speeds depending on your enrage% of the kill
      • 100% - 1
      • 500% - 2
      • 1000% - 4
      • 2000% - 8
    • The drop chance of a rare item used to be capped at a 1 in 20 chance with bad luck mitigation, if you are doing a higher enraged kill this cap is lowered further to 1 in 10 at 1000% and 1 in 5 at 2000%
    • Added bronze Lord of Chaos and Wrath of Chaos titles, achieved for a 1000% enrage kill in solo and a group respectively.
  • patch 8 August 2022 (Update):
    • Made changes to the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos rare drop table to incentivise pushing higher enrages:
      • Rare drop chance now increases further with boss enrage.
      • Bow piece chance also increases with boss enrage.
    • During Phase 7 of the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos encounter, the Chaos Demon(s) that spawn into Infernus could be used to negate the damage done by the attack itself. This should no longer occur.
    • Completing a Zamorak, Lord of Chaos kill at 2000% enrage now unlocks the Chaos Witch Master outfit, rather than the Chaos Witch Adept outfit.
    • The completion of the boss collection log now broadcasts correctly.
  • patch 25 July 2022 (Update):
    • Fixed an issue that meant players needed 100 solo and 100 group kills of the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos boss to unlock Insane Final Boss, rather than 100 kills combined.
    • Fixed an issue that prevented Zamorak's attacks from reaching the player in phase seven if they are stood next to the Infernus Portal.
  • ninja 18 July 2022 (Update):
    • Adjusted Zamorak's common drop table:
      • The value of Zamorak's common drops were reduced, which is increased if the Elite Dungeon was fully completed.[source needed]
      • Sirenic scales have been replaced with blood runes.
    • Adjusted the weighting of rares on Zamorak's drop table:
      • Chaos Roar ability codices are less common.[source needed]
      • Bow pieces are more common.[source needed]
    • Players will now be awarded more common loot and higher chances at rare drops for Zamorak when running the Elite Dungeon.
    • Following feedback, changes have been made to the way group enrage works for The Zamorakian Undercity encounter:
      • Enrage is now shared between groups of 2-5 players, meaning your highest Enrage will be applied to every group size.
      • Messaging has been updated at the end of a Zamorak, Lord of Chaos encounter to clearly state the highest enrage you have achieved.
      • Solo enrage is tracked separately and remains unchanged.
      • When you next log in, your enrages from groups of 2-5 will be looked at by the system and the highest amount will be taken. A chatbox message will appear to inform you of this.
    • During the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos fight, if you are within Infernus, you will now hear Zamorak's voice over:
      • If you are in a solo encounter, you will hear the voice over from the Decimate attack.
      • If you are in a group encounter, you'll hear all of the voice over whilst inside Infernus.
    • To avoid any confusion when trying to enter a Zamorakian Undercity Elite Dungeon with loot to claim, the following change has been made:
      • A new interface will appear when clicking the chest, allowing players to choose between collecting dungeon loot or boss loot.
    • Following feedback, the amount of Soul Reaper kills given out for a Zamorak, Lord of Chaos task has been brought in-line with other Elite Dungeon boss tasks.
      • Reduced Soul Reaper task of 1-4 (2-8 extended) to 1-3 (2-6 extended).
    • If you have Freedom Mode unlocked for The Zamorakian Undercity, using the Zamorak teleport will now place you directly inside the arena, rather than outside the portal.
      • If the boss fight has already started, you will not be able to teleport into the arena.
    • Added a quick chat option for Zamorak kills and highest enrage.
    • During the Infernal Tomb mechanic in the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos fight, the Chaos Demon will now spawn in facing east (towards the portal), rather than south.
    • Fixed an issue that would cause Zamorak to appear in an incorrect location during phase seven of the Zamorak, Lord of Chaos boss fight.
    • The Inner Chaos buff is now cleared after killing Zamorak and teleporting away from the boss arena.
    • Whilst in Infernus during the Zamorakian Undercity Elite Dungeon, the 'escape' option on the portals didn't actually do anything! Now, you will be able to leave the dungeon completely, as intended.
    • Zamorak, Lord of Chaos is now correctly displayed on the grim gem.
    • Signature drop animation changed from red flames on character to green spores to be more visually seen, as the red flames blended with the arena's ground texture.
  • hotfix :
    • Fixed an issue where Zamorak's world-ending attack charge would reset in encounters of 1500%+ enrage.
  • hotfix 6 July 2022:
    • Fixed a rare issue where players could be hit with Zamorak’s world ending attack during phase 7 after teleporting out / dying.
    • Fixed an issue causing lower player attack range during phase 7, preventing some abilities from being used.
  • hotfix 4 July 2022:
    • Zamorak Enrage can now correctly be progressed beyond 20%.
    • Rare item drops from Zamorak will now correctly trigger broadcasts.
  • update 4 July 2022 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Before it was changed to green particles, the animation displayed on the player chosen to receive a rare reward was originally a set of red sparks rising from the ground.
  • The group version of the Zamorak encounter was originally going to feature a "Revive Player" extra action button that would let players revive their teammates a limited number of times during the fight. This feature was cut before release due to balancing concerns.[4]
  • Although the Beasts tab lists Zamorak's combat level as 14,000, the in-game tooltip when right-clicking and targetting him instead displays a combat level of 10,000.
  • As of 13 December 2022, players have died to Zamorak 1,095,971 times.[5]
  • Zamorak's line, "This world will burn!" is said by Delrith in the Demon Slayer quest.

Notes[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ That is the expected value of the number of kills.
